byline.original: By MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT and CHOE SANG-HUN

abstract: Defense Dept reports North Korea's test of ballistic missile, apparently timed to celebrate 104th birthday of country's founder, was failure; missile is believed to be of intermediate-range class that could potentially reach American military bases in Guam.
lead_paragraph: The Defense Department said that its radar systems “detected and tracked” a North Korea launch that “did not pose a threat to North America.”

headline.main: North Korea Ballistic Missile Launch a Failure, Pentagon Says
headline.print_headline: North Korea Missile Launch Is Called Failure by Pentagon

snippet: The Defense Department said that its radar systems “detected and tracked” a North Korea launch that “did not pose a threat to North America.”

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
